alert.note: Alert for San Benito (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 9:21AM PDT until March 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Rainfall will taper off through the late morning, but receiving reports of flooding over Highway 101, specifically affecting northbound lanes of 101 between Sargent and Highway 25. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Santa Clara County and northern San Benito County, including Hollister and the 101 corridor south of Gilroy down to the Pajaro River. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 AM PDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gilroy, Miller, Sargent, Hollister. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
